data.title: Great food!
data.text: My wife and I stopped by mid afternoon between her two nearby doctors appointments.  I wasn't really in the mood for a burger and my wife was nursing a recent stomach virus, so we can't review how the burgers are.  But I had a Philly Chesse sandwich and it was absolutely one of the best I've ever eaten in my life.  My wife had a good grilled cheese sandwich.  The onion rings were fresh and outstanding!  The sausage balls also were delicious.  The only reason we can't rate this as excellent is my wife had a vanilla shake and said it was not quite as tasty as she would have liked.  Service was very good and the facilities are neat and clean.  We will be back we are in town!

data.title: Great burger
data.text: My husband had the Bella burger and said it was delicious. I had the apple nut salad and was also very good.  The service was excellent.

data.title: Good food, Great service
data.text:
My hubby and I came here for a late lunch because we'd heard good reviews. 

Food: My "groove burger" was delicious, especially the caramelized onions and house pickles! But it got messy and I eventually resorted to using a knife and fork.  I also enjoyed the fried pickles. My hubby, a picky eater, really enjoyed his plain burger with ketchup and mustard and fries. My hubby also appreciated that there was good beer available. 

Service: We were quick to be seated and have drink and food orders taken. The waitress was especially patient with my hubby as he took forever to decide what beer he wanted. The waitress and staff checked on us often, but not in an overly suffocating way. They even checked on us again after we paid and were just taking up space. 

Atmosphere: My hubby called it post-modern industrial. It was not cozy or particularly comfy. I found the metal chairs quite uncomfortable for my wide butt. Thankfully my hubby let me switch with him and I got to sit on a wooden bench instead. 

Price: We got one appetizer, two big burgers, one side, one beer and one soda for $30. I feel like we got our money's worth in volume AND quality!

data.title: Lunch with family!
data.text:
We stopped in for a quick bite and were pleasantly surprised at the menu options at this recently opened location: it's a small venue, bite there is ample seating (both indoors and out) and generous parking.

The service was friendly and, while the food took about 10-15 minutes to get to us (post-order), it was definitely good! 

My only complaint is it wasn't as savory as I would've liked. The fries were pretty bland and my husband noted the same could be said of the onion rings.

I had a veggie burger (freshly made) and it was tasty! Much better than whatever you'd find at Chilis or elsewhere and it was obviously made fresh--that was a plus!

As for the price ...it's a step above fast-food so you'll pay Applebee's and Chilis prices but, for the overall quality, it's well worth a visit.

We'll certainly go again!

data.title: Yummy! Great service!
data.text: My husband and I just ate here for the first time today for lunch. I got a hamburger, fried okra which was the best okra I have ever had in my life, onion rings, french fries and the street corn.  Everything was fresh and very good. The hamburger the prettiest hamburger I've ever seen. 😊 They have Pepsi products which I don't like but they had a delicious homemade lemonade. It is a little pricey for a burger but we wanted to try something different in town and we did like the food. We will definitely be back!

data.title: Not worth your time
data.text: I knew this place opened up recently and I really wanted to try it because I always want a different place to go than the typical five guys. They do have a lot of options for a burger place. They have beef, turkey, chicken breast, and veggie burgers. The beef is supposed to be cooked medium too. I was with a friend and we ordered and sat down. The lady at the counter wasn't really friendly. The place wasn't busy, but we had to wait a long time to get our food. They forgot to cook mine at the same time and had to wait an additional 5 minutes for my food. My friend got fries with their food. The fries weren't seasoned at all and weren't cooked too great. Her burger wasn't that great either. I ordered the groove burger and onion rings. The burger didn't taste that good at all. The caramelized onions weren't good on it at all and the burger wasn't seasoned good. I don't know how you can mess up a bacon cheeseburger with onions but they did. The onion rings were ok. They weren't cooked enough for me. The best part of the meal was the breading on the onion rings. I'd say not to waste your time here and go to five guys or grind house to get a good burger.

data.title: Preppy Burgers -- Spartan Surroundings
data.text: We visited for an early evening dinner.  The restaurant was not crowded.  We were greeted warmly by a young woman at the order/cashier counter.  After ordering and paying we were able to select our own table after getting our own soft drinks.  Music was too loud for conversation and the tables/chairs are more suitable for a patio.  The menu had too many items for a small restaurant specializing in burgers.  Burgers had no sides included.  We ordered burgers and onion rings which were delivered to the table by a server.  Burgers are custom prepared.  Onion rings were very good.  Burgers tasted good, although a little greasy.  There are a number of TV screens.  Suspect that this location will do better later in the evening with the sports bar crowd.  This restaurant recently opened.  It is in an area with lots of competition.
